00025 #ifndef _BASE_CONSTS_
00026 #define _BASE_CONSTS_
00027 
00028 #include <base/Object>
00029 
00030 
00031 namespace base {
00032 
00033 
00035 class Consts : public Object
00036 {
00037 public:
00038   virtual String className() const { return String("Consts"); }
00039 
00040   const static Real epsilon = Real(1e-10);
00041   const static Real epsilon2 = Real(1e-20);
00042   const static Real minReal = Real(1.17549435e-38f); // get these from <limits> when available
00043   const static Real maxReal = Real(3.40282347e+38f);
00044   const static SInt minSInt  = (-2147483647-1);
00045   const static SInt maxSInt  = 2147483647;
00046   const static Int  minInt  = 0;
00047   const static Int  maxInt  = 4294967293U;
00048   const static Real Pi = Real(3.1415926535897932384626433832795029L); // can't seem to get M_PI from cmath (?)
00049   const static Real SqrtHalf = Real(0.7071067811865475244008443621048490);
00050   const static Real TwoPi = Real(Pi*2.0);
00051   const static Real Infinity = maxReal;
00052 
00053   
00054 protected:
00055   // can't instantiate it
00056   Consts() {}
00057   Consts(const Consts&) {}
00058   virtual ~Consts() {}
00059 };
00060 
00061 
00062   // NB: Unfortunately, these are identical to functions in Math, just here 
00063   //     as they are used in many inline headers before they can include
00064   //     Math (otherwise they'd have to be not inline and we'd take
00065   //     a performance hit.
00066 
00067   // equals within eps (i.e. true if |r1-r2| < eps)
00068   inline bool equals(const Real r1, const Real r2, Real eps = Consts::epsilon)
00069   { return ::fabs(r1-r2) < eps; }
00070 
00071   // absolute value (i.e. |s|)
00072   inline Real abs(Real s) { return ::fabs(s); }
00073 
00074   // squate root (i.e. n^.5)
00075   inline Real sqrt(Real n) { return ::sqrt(n); }
00076 
00077   inline Real sin(Real a) { return ::sin(a); }
00078   inline Real cos(Real a) { return ::cos(a); }
00079 
00080 
00081 } // base
00082 
00083 #endif
